Package game

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Asteroid
    Asteroids will be used to create an asteroid and store information such as damage.
    BackgroundPanel
    Handles tasks such as shaking the background during scripted sequences, drawing background parallax images and HUD elements such as health, score, etc.
    Bullet
    Responsible for everything related to bullets.
    CollisionHandler
    Handles all the collisions which occurs with bodies in the game.
    Enemy
    Creates enemies in the game and stores the necessary information about them (health, damage).
    Game
    Class that will hold the current different states of the game and handle different tasks such as loading new levels.
    ItemPickup
    The items that are able to be picked up by the player such as health, armour, ammo, gold, etc.
    KeyHandler
    Responsible for handling all the keystroke events where the user presses a key while the game is running.
    LevelEditor
    Acts as a 'middle-man' between SuperLevel which holds all the information that is specific to the level editor.
    LevelEditorUI
    Handles with the UI controls in the top-left corner while in the level editor.
    LevelFive
    Stores and handles with everything unique to level 5.
    LevelFour
    Stores and handles with everything unique to level 4.
    LevelOne
    Stores and handles with everything unique to level 1.
    LevelSix
    Stores and handles with everything unique to level 6.
    LevelThree
    Stores and handles with everything unique to level 3.
    LevelTwo
    Stores and handles with everything unique to level 2.
    MainCharacter
    The player character.
    MainMenu
    Handles with the UI controls in the main menu.
    Menu
    Stores and handles with everything unique to the Main Menu.
    MouseHandler
    Responsible for handling all the mouse events (such as when the player presses a mouse button or moves the mouse within the frame).
    Platform
    Solid platforms (standard platforms, ground, or crumbing platforms) used in the game.
    Score
    The high, previous, and current score that is displayed in the game HUD.
    StepHandler
    Handles everything that needs to be checked on continuously (such as player movement, updating score time, etc.)
    SuperLevel
    Handles everything relating to the world (e.g.
    UIControls
    Handles with the UI controls in the top-left corner while in the game.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    STATE
    Stores states which are used to determine which mode the player is currently in.
